## Description {#details}

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> handle that tracks a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> across RAUW.

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/trackingvh">TrackingVH</a> is designed for situations where a client needs to hold a handle to a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> (or subclass) across some operations which may move that value, but should never destroy it or replace it with some unacceptable type.

It is an error to attempt to replace a value with one of a type which is incompatible with any of its outstanding TrackingVHs.

It is an error to read from a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/trackingvh">TrackingVH</a> that does not point to a valid value. A <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/trackingvh">TrackingVH</a> is said to not point to a valid value if either it hasn&#39;t yet been assigned a value yet or because the value it was tracking has since been deleted.

Assigning a value to a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/trackingvh">TrackingVH</a> is always allowed, even if said <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/trackingvh">TrackingVH</a> no longer points to a valid value.

Definition at line 331 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/valuehandle-h">ValueHandle.h</a>.
